articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of a crowded district in the heart of Rafah on Wednesday during one of the most intense nights of bombardment of the southern Gaza city since Israel launched its offensive there this month.
articles.title: Israeli forces move deeper into Rafah in night of heavy battle

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill, William James
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called a national election for July 4 on Wednesday, saying Britons would be able to choose their future in a vote his Conservatives are widely expected to lose to the opposition Labour Party after 14 years in power.
articles.title: Rishi Sunak calls UK national election for July 4

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy issued a fresh plea on Wednesday for upgraded defence systems to protect Ukraine's cities against guided bombs, which he described as the "the main instrument" now used by Moscow in its attacks.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukraine needs system to defend against Russia's guided bombs

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader led prayers in Tehran on Wednesday at the funeral of the late President Ebrahim Raisi, as the clerical establishment hurried to organise an early election that could further erode its legitimacy amid growing public discontent.
articles.title: Iran Supreme Leader leads prayers at Raisi funeral as election looms

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Already under global pressure over the mounting toll from the war in Gaza, Israel slipped further into international isolation on Wednesday after three European countries broke with their main EU partners and decided to recognise a Palestinian state.
articles.title: European countries' recognition of Palestine deepens Israeli isolation

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Simon Lewis, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Wednesday said the United States and Saudi Arabia were very close to concluding a set of agreements on nuclear energy, security and defense cooperation, which are part of a wider normalisation deal with Riyadh and Israel.
articles.title: Blinken says US-Saudi pacts could be 'weeks away' from completion

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron landed in the Pacific island of New Caledonia on Thursday, for a day of talks during which he will aim to turn the page on deadly riots triggered by a contested electoral reform.
articles.title: Macron arrives in riot-hit New Caledonia for high-stakes talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Democratic Republic of Congo's national assembly elected Vital Kamerhe, whose home was violently attacked on Sunday, as speaker in a delayed vote, a key step towards installing a government five months after a presidential election.
articles.title: DRC parliament elects speaker in delayed vote days after foiled coup

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: Ecuadorean President Daniel Noboa on Wednesday declared a new state of emergency in seven of the country's 24 provinces, as well as one area of a further province, citing a rise in the number of violent deaths and other crimes in those jurisdictions.
articles.title: Ecuador's Noboa declares new security state of emergency

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli television aired previously withheld footage on Wednesday of five pyjama-clad female army conscripts being seized by Hamas gunmen during the Oct. 7 raid that triggered the Gaza war.
articles.title: Israel releases film of female conscripts held by Hamas
